intro: Cleisostoma crucicallum, commonly known as the Crucifix Venus flytrap, is a carnivorous plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its unique, lid-like leaves that close rapidly when triggered by touch. The plant produces small, white flowers with a distinctive cruciform shape, resembling a cross. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires high humidity and well-draining soil. Its specialized leaves are adapted to capture and digest insects, providing essential nutrients in nutrient-poor soils.
